text:
In the Lenya 1.2RC2 version I didn't manage to startup the 
BXE integration using Mozilla 1.6b.  This seems due to the invalid
xhtml generated for the startup page.  Basically it generates an additional
xhtml namespace declaration and Mozilla doesn't know how
to handle a "onload" on a xhtml:xhtml:body tag.  The 
xhtml:xhtml:script tag may also not work.


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
<!DOCTYPE xhtml:html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<xhtml:html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"
xmlns:xhtml="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><xhtml:head><xhtml:meta
content="xhtml=http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" name="bxeNS" /><xhtml:meta
content="dc=http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" name="bxeNS" /><xhtml:meta
content="lenya=http://apache.org/cocoon/lenya/page-envelope/1.0" name="bxeNS" />

<!-- Namespaces are doctype specific and will be added during aggregation -->

<xhtml:link rel="stylesheet" href="/bxeng/css/editor.css" type="text/css" />
<!-- href="/bxeng/css/editor.css" -->

<xhtml:script src="/bxeng/bxeLoader.js" type="text/javascript" />
<!-- src="/bxeng/bxeLoader.js" -->


<title>/default/authoring/concepts.html?lenya.usecase=bxe&lenya.step=config</title>

</xhtml:head><xhtml:body
onload="bxe_start('/default/authoring/concepts.html?lenya.usecase=bxe&lenya.step=config')">
creator: arjen@pinguins.dyndns.org
